messages.content: ComfyQR-scanning-nodes is a set of ComfyUI nodes to quickly test generated QR codes for scannability. It is a companion project to Comfy-QR.
Where is ComfyQR-scanning-nodes managed and mirrored?
ComfyQR-scanning-nodes is managed publicly on Gitlab and mirrored on Github.
What are the two custom nodes currently contained in ComfyQR-scanning-nodes?
The two custom nodes currently contained in ComfyQR-scanning-nodes are the 'Read QR Code' node and the 'Validate QR Code' node.
What library does the 'Read QR Code' node use to extract text from a QR code?
The 'Read QR Code' node uses the pyzbar library to extract text from a QR code.
What are the possible output values of the 'VALIDATION_CODE' in the 'Validate QR Code' node?
The 'VALIDATION_CODE' in the 'Validate QR Code' node can output 0 for a perfect match, 1 for an unreadable QR, and 2 for a text mismatch.
How can you reduce false negatives with pyzbar when the border size of a QR is small?
To reduce false negatives with pyzbar when the border size of a QR is small, you can add a 'Pad Image for Outpainting' node before sending it to the 'Read QR Code' node.
What are the pros of choosing pyzbar for QR code reading in ComfyQR-scanning-nodes?
pyzbar is chosen for QR code reading in ComfyQR-scanning-nodes based on the amount of dependencies, recency of updates, and popularity.
